title: Homemade Spaghetti Sauce with Ground Beef
description: Top spaghetti or your favorite pasta with this mom's meaty spaghetti sauce that's oh-so easy to make, and ready in just over an hour.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Combine ground beef, onion, garlic, and green pepper in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until meat is browned and crumbly and vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain grease. Step3: Stir diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and tomato paste into the pan. Season with oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer spaghetti sauce for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Step4: Serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef, 1 medium onion, chopped, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 small green bell pepper, diced, 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, 1 (16 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste, 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 2 teaspoons dried basil, 1 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper

title: Copycat Chick-Fil-A Honey Mustard
description: Now you can make this distinct, addictive copycat version of Chick-Fil-A honey mustard at home.
directions: Step1: Whisk together mustard, honey, corn syrup, molasses, tamarind paste, and salt  in a bowl until well blended. Chill until ready to serve.  Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks.
ingredients: ½ cup yellow mustard, ⅓ cup honey, 2 tablespoons corn syrup, ¼ teaspoon dark molasses, ¼ teaspoon tamarind paste, ¼ teaspoon kosher salt

title: Air Fryer Green Beans
description: The fresh flavors of summer come alive in these air fryer green beans, a very simple side dish. They pair well with grilled chicken, fish or pork.
directions: Step1: Preheat the air fryer to 380 degrees F (195 degrees C). Step2: Place green beans, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a large bowl and toss to coat. Using tongs, place green beans into the air fryer basket without overcrowding, reserving any remaining liquid in the bowl. You may need to work in batches, depending on the size of your air fryer. Step3: Cook green beans until crisp-tender, 8 to 10 minutes, shaking the basket halfway through. When green beans are done, return to the bowl and toss with the lemon zest. Serve with additional lemon wedges.
ingredients: 1 pound fresh green beans, ends trimmed, 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon lemon zest, salt and pepper, to taste, 4 lemon wedges

title: Grilled Sesame-Soy Shishito Peppers
description: These grilled shishito peppers with ginger, garlic, sesame, and soy might become your new favorite summer side — great with grilled salmon or steak.
directions: Step1: Whisk sesame oil, soy sauce, ginger, and garlic together in a large bowl. Add shishito peppers and toss to combine. Let marinate for 15 to 20 minutes, tossing occasionally. Step2: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and heat a grill pan. Step3: Remove peppers from marinade, letting excess marinade drip back into the bowl. Place peppers on the grill pan and cook, tossing every 1 to 2 minutes, until evenly charred, 5 to 7 minutes. Return peppers to bowl with marinade and toss. Sprinkle with salt, if desired, and serve.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 0.5 teaspoon finely grated ginger, 0.5 teaspoon grated garlic, 8 ounces shishito peppers, rinsed, salt to taste

title: Quick Tartar Sauce
description: Whip up this quick and easy tartar sauce with only 4 common ingredients when you're in a hurry.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Add mayonnaise, relish, mustard, and lemon juice together in a bowl. Step3: Stir until thoroughly combined. Step4: Serve immediately or refrigerate the sauce until ready to serve.
ingredients: 1 cup mayonnaise, 2 teaspoons sweet pickle relish, 1 teaspoon prepared yellow mustard, 1 teaspoon lemon juice

title: Awesome Broccoli-Cheese Casserole
description: This tasty broccoli cheese casserole will turn even the pickiest of eaters into broccoli fans! Pairs well with Thanksgiving turkey or Christmas ham.
directions: Step1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish. Step2: Whisk condensed soup, mayonnaise, egg, and onions together in a medium mixing bowl until combined. Step3: Place frozen broccoli into a very large mixing bowl and break it up if necessary; add soup mixture and mix well to coat. Sprinkle with cheese and mix well; spread mixture into the prepared baking dish. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika. Step4: Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
ingredients: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup mayonnaise, 1 egg, beaten, 0.25 cup chopped onion, 3 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped broccoli, 8 ounces shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, salt and pepper to taste, 1 dash paprika

title: Old Fashioned Onion Rings
description: These delicious onion rings are easy to make at home. The breaded coating fries up perfectly crispy while the onion itself stays sweet and tender.
directions: Step1: Slice onion into 1/4-inch-thick rings. Step2: Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C). Place a wire rack over a sheet of aluminum foil. Step3: Prepare breading station by setting out 3 wide, shallow dishes. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in the first dish. Whisk milk and egg together in the second dish. Place bread crumbs in the third dish. Step4: Dip each onion ring into the flour mixture, turning several times until fully coated with flour. Transfer to the egg mixture and use a fork to turn until coated. Lift onion with the fork and shake gently so excess liquid drips back into the dish. Place onion in the bread crumbs and turn several times to coat, scooping crumbs over the ring if necessary. Lift again with the fork, tap any excess bread crumbs back into the dish, and place on the wire rack while you prepare the remaining onion rings. Step5: Deep-fry 3 to 4 onion rings at a time in the preheated oil until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain on paper towels while you deep-fry the remaining rings. Step6: Sprinkle with seasoning salt before serving.
ingredients: 1 large Vidalia or other sweet onion, 1 quart oil for frying, or as needed, 1.25 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup milk, or as needed, 1 large egg, 0.75 cup dry bread crumbs, 0.125 teaspoon seasoned salt, or to taste

title: One-Pan Creamy Orzo
description: This one-pan creamy orzo side dish is similar to a risotto but is quick and easy to make.
directions: Step1: Melt butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add orzo and toast, stirring, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in garlic; reduce heat to medium-low. Step2: Add chicken broth, 1/2 cup at a time. Simmer, stirring frequently, until broth is absorbed, about 8 minutes. Step3: Once broth is absorbed, stir in cream. Add cheese; stir until cheese melts into the creamy sauce.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, 2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste, 3/4 cup orzo pasta, 1 1/2 cups chicken broth, 1/4 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup freshly shredded Parmesan cheese

title: TikTok Parmesan-Crusted Roasted Potatoes
description: We made the viral parmesan-crusted roasted potato recipe from TikTok even better with an updated method for the crispiest potatoes.
directions: Step1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place butter in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish or nonstick baking pan and place in the oven until the butter melts, about 4 minutes. Step2: While the butter melts, score potatoes about 1/4-inch-deep in a diamond pattern (crosshatch). Set aside. Step3: Remove the pan from the oven and let cool slightly, about 2 minutes. Stir Parmesan cheese, garlic and herb seasoning, and salt into butter to form a paste. Spread about 1 teaspoon of the Parmesan paste on the cut-side of each potato; arrange, cut-side down, in the pan. Place in the preheated oven. Step4: Bake until the potatoes are tender and the Parmesan creates a golden crust on the bottom of the potatoes, about 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before using a spatula to release potatoes from pan.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 (24 ounce) package baby Yukon Gold potatoes, halved, 0.5 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 1.5 teaspoons garlic and herb seasoning, 1 teaspoon kosher salt

title: Buttery Garlic Green Beans
description: This easy, 5-ingredient green bean recipe featuring fresh green beans sautéed in a buttery garlic sauce is perfect to serve at any meal.
directions: Step1: Place green beans into a large skillet and cover with water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until beans just start to soften, 3 to 5 minutes. Step2: Drain and return to the skillet. Add butter and stir until melted, 1 to 2 minutes. Step3: Add garlic; cook until tender and fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Step4: Season with lemon-pepper seasoning and salt before serving.
ingredients: 1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed and snapped in half, 3 tablespoons butter, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 0.125 teaspoon lemon-pepper seasoning, or more to taste, salt to taste

title: Sour Cream Mashed Potatoes
description: These sour cream mashed potatoes are wonderfully smooth and fluffy with a rich garlic finish.
directions: Step1: Place potatoes and 1 1/2 tablespoons of the salt in a large stock pot. Add enough cold water to cover potatoes by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-high and boil until potatoes can be easily pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Step2: Meanwhile, place salted butter and garlic in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally until garlic is fragrant and white milk solids have separated from butter, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cover to keep warm. Step3: Remove potatoes from heat and drain in a colander. Return potatoes to the pot; add milk, sour cream, unsalted butter, 2 teaspoons salt, and pepper. Step4: Mash using a potato masher until smooth. (Avoid over-mashing or the starches will form a glue-like texture.) Transfer to a serving bowl. Step5: Pour garlic butter through a fine mesh strainer into a small bowl. Discard milk solids and garlic. Step6: Pour butter over mashed potatoes and sprinkle with scallions.
ingredients: 3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks, 1.5 tablespoons kosher salt, 0.5 cup salted butter, cubed, 4 large cloves garlic, crushed, 1 cup whole milk, warmed, 1 cup sour cream, 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, cubed, 2 teaspoons kosher salt, 0.5 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 2 tablespoons thinly sliced scallions

title: Oven Roasted Sweet Potatoes
description: Perfectly cooked, roasted sweet potatoes with caramelized onion and garlic are finished with a drizzle of balsamic vinegar in this delicious recipe.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Step3: Mix sweet potatoes, onion, and garlic in a bowl. Drizzle olive oil over the mixture and toss to coat; pour into a shallow roasting pan. Step4: Roast sweet potato mixture in the preheated oven, turning frequently, until the vegetables are soft and golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes. Step5: Remove from the oven. Drizzle balsamic vinegar over the vegetables; season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 4 cups chopped peeled sweet potato, 1 sweet onion, cut into wedges, 2 cloves garlic, sliced, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, or more to taste, 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste

title: Marsala Sauce
description: This classic Italian marsala sauce is easy-to-make, rich, and earthy. It tastes great over steak, chicken, pork, potatoes, or polenta.
directions: Step1: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add mushrooms, shallot, garlic, and rosemary and cook, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Step2: Sprinkle flour over the mushroom mixture and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Deglaze the pan by pouring in the marsala, and cook for about 2 minutes. Step3: Increase heat to medium, stir in beef broth and port, and cook until sauce starts to reduce and thicken to your preference, 10 to 12 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, taste, and adjust any of the ingredients to your liking.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, 8 ounces white mushrooms, sliced, 1 medium shallot, minced, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 1 teaspoon crushed dried rosemary, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 0.75 cup Marsala wine, 1 cup beef broth, or more as needed, 2 tablespoons port wine, salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

title: Simple Teriyaki Sauce
description: This quick and easy homemade teriyaki sauce is the perfect Japanese touch for meat, fish, noodle stir fries, rice dishes or as a dip for chicken wings or dumplings.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Combine 1 cup water, soy sauce, brown sugar, honey, ginger, and garlic powder in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until nearly heated through, about 1 minute. Step3: Mix cornstarch and 1/4 cold water together in a cup; stir until dissolved. Add to the saucepan. Step4: Cook and stir sauce until thickened, 5 to 7 minutes. Step5: Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 cup water, 0.25 cup soy sauce, 5 teaspoons packed brown sugar, 1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste, 0.5 teaspoon ground ginger, 0.25 teaspoon garlic powder, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 0.25 cup cold water

title: Gourmet Mushroom Risotto
description: This authentic Italian-style mushroom risotto takes time to prepare, but it's worth the wait. It's the perfect complement for grilled meats and chicken dishes.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Warm broth in a saucepan over low heat. Step3: Meanwhile, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add portobello and white mushrooms; cook and stir until soft, about 3 minutes. Remove mushrooms and their liquid to a bowl; set aside. Step4: Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the saucepan. Stir in shallots and cook for 1 minute. Add rice; cook and stir until rice is coated with oil and pale, golden in color, about 2 minutes. Step5: Pour in wine, stirring constantly until wine is fully absorbed. Add 1/2 cup warm broth to the rice, and stir until the broth is absorbed. Step6: Continue adding broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly, until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, yet firm to the bite, about 15 to 20 minutes. Step7: Remove from heat. Stir in reserved mushrooms and their liquid, butter, chives, and Parmesan cheese. Step8: Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
ingredients: 6 cups chicken broth, or as needed, 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided, 1 pound portobello mushrooms, thinly sliced, 1 pound white mushrooms, thinly sliced, 2 medium shallots, diced, 1.5 cups Arborio rice, 0.5 cup dry white wine, 4 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons finely chopped chives, 0.33333334326744 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

title: Zucchini Patties
description: These cheesy zucchini patties make a lovely change from potato pancakes during summer squash season. Serve with tomato sauce or sour cream on top.
directions: Step1: Place zucchini, eggs, flour, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, onion, and salt in a medium bowl; stir until well combined. Step2: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Step3: Scoop tablespoonfuls of zucchini mixture into hot oil and fry, working in batches, until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
ingredients: 2 cups grated zucchini, 2 eggs, beaten, 0.5 cup all-purpose flour, 0.5 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 0.5 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 0.25 cup chopped onion, salt to taste, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil

title: Cabbage Steaks
description: Cabbage steaks are simple to prepare and easy to customize. They make a great side dish or vegetarian entree, baked to perfection in the oven.
directions: Step1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Step2: Cut the bottom off of the cabbage and set it so the flat end is on the cutting board; cut into 1-inch thick slices. Arrange slices in a single layer in a large casserole dish. Step3: Drizzle oil over cabbage slices and sprinkle with garlic. Season cabbage with salt and pepper. Cover the dish with aluminum foil. Step4: Bake in the preheated oven until cabbage core is easily pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes.
ingredients: 1 head cabbage, 2 tablespoons light olive oil, 2 tablespoons minced garlic, 0.5 teaspoon salt, or to taste, 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste

title: Sauce Vierge
description: Sauce vierge is a French sauce with olive oil, lemon juice, tomatoes, and basil that goes well with seafood and can be served hot or cold.
directions: Step1: Dice tomatoes, and place in a colander for about 5 minutes to drain. Step2: Transfer drained tomatoes to a bowl, and gently fold in shallots, garlic, parsley, tarragon, Kalamata olives, and basil. Step3: Pour olive oil and lemon juice over the vegetables, and stir until combined. Allow mixture to sit for about 30 minutes for the flavors to meld.
ingredients: 5 small tomatoes (such as Campari(R)), 2 tablespoons minced shallots, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon, 2 tablespoons pitted and vertically-sliced Kalamata olives, 8 large basil leaves, chopped, 0.25 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice, salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

title: Cowboy Candy (Candied Jalapenos)
description: Fresh jalapenos are simmered with brown sugar and spices to create cowboy candy.
directions: Step1: While wearing gloves, rinse jalapenos and remove stem. Cut into 1/4-inch slices and set aside. To reduce the heat from the peppers, you may core out the centers with the seeds and discard before slicing. Step2: Combine brown sugar and apple cider vinegar in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic powder, celery seed, turmeric, cumin seed, anise seed, salt and red pepper flakes. Bring to a simmer for 3 minutes. Add sliced jalapeno peppers and simmer for an additional 4 to 5 minutes. Step3: Remove jalapenos to a jar using a slotted spoon. Continue simmering liquid over medium-low heat until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes more. Step4: Pour liquid over the jalapenos and let cool. Use a strainer to remove excess seeds from the liquid, if desired. Refrigerate for a minimum of 3 days before eating. Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
ingredients: 1 pound jalapeno peppers, sliced into 1/4-inch pieces, 1.75 cups brown sugar, 0.75 cup apple cider vinegar, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder, 0.5 teaspoon celery seed, 0.5 teaspoon ground turmeric, 0.25 teaspoon cumin seed, 0.25 teaspoon anise seed, 0.25 teaspoon salt, 0.25 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 1 pint-size canning jar

title: Alfredo Sauce
description: This creamy Alfredo sauce recipe will transform a busy weeknight dinner into something special! Serve it with fettuccine, chicken, or steamed veggies.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir in cream and simmer for 5 minutes. Step3: Add cheese and garlic; whisk continuously until heated through. Stir in parsley and serve. Step4: Serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients: 0.25 cup butter, 1 cup heavy cream, 1.5 cups freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 1 clove garlic, crushed, 0.25 cup chopped fresh parsley

title: Best Green Bean Casserole
description: This green bean casserole pairs tender green beans with crunchy French-fried onions in creamy cheese sauce. A family-favorite recipe for the holidays!
directions: Step1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Step2: Mix green beans and condensed soup together in a large microwave-safe bowl until well combined. Microwave on high until warm, 3 to 5 minutes. Step3: Stir 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese into the green bean mixture. Microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes. Step4: Transfer mixture to a casserole dish and spread evenly over the bottom. Sprinkle French-fried onions over top, then sprinkle with remaining Cheddar. Step5: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and the onions are just turning brown, about 10 minutes.
ingredients: 2 (14.5 ounce) cans green beans, drained, 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided, 1 (6 ounce) can French-fried onions

title: Jamie's Sweet and Easy Corn on the Cob
description: Corn on the cob is cooked in boiled water that's flavored with a little sugar and lemon juice to make the sweetest, quickest, tastiest corn.
directions: Step1: Fill a large pot about 3/4 full of water and bring to a boil. Stir in sugar and lemon juice until sugar is dissolved. Step2: Gently place ears of corn into boiling water, cover the pot, turn off the heat, and let corn cook in the hot water until tender, about 10 minutes.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 6 ears corn on the cob, husks and silk removed

title: How to Make Gravy from Scratch
description: Learn how to make gravy from scratch with pan drippings (or butter) with this quick and easy recipe.
directions: Step1: Gather all ingredients. Step2: Pour pan drippings into a large measuring cup. Scrap the browned bits into a 2 cup measure. Step3: Skim and reserve fat from drippings. Step4: Pour 1/4 cup of the fat into a medium saucepan. If you don’t have 1/4 cup fat, add enough butter to equal 1/4 cup. Set over medium heat. Step5: Whisk in flour. Continue cooking for 1 to 2 minutes, whisking constantly. Step6: Add stock or broth to the remaining drippings in the measuring cup to equal 2 cups. Step7: Slowly whisk in stock mixture until fully incorporated. Step8: Cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat until thickened and bubbly, Cook and stir 1 minute more. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
ingredients: pan drippings from roasted chicken or 1/4 cup butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups chicken stock or broth, Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

title: Oven-Roasted Asparagus
description: Tender roasted asparagus, seasoned with minced garlic, Parmesan cheese, and lemon juice. Pairs perfectly with roast leg of lamb or grilled fish.
directions: Step1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Step2: Place asparagus into a mixing bowl; drizzle with olive oil and toss to coat. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, garlic, salt, and pepper. Arrange asparagus in a single layer in a baking dish. Step3: Bake in the preheated oven until just tender, 12 to 15 minutes depending on thickness. Sprinkle with lemon juice just before serving.
ingredients: 1 bunch thin asparagus spears, trimmed, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1.5 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon sea salt, 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon lemon juice

title: Garlic Sautéed Vegetables
description: Garlic sauteed vegetables cooked in chicken broth make a great side dish to any meal.
directions: Step1: Heat the oil in a 12-inch skillet over high heat. Add the red pepper, cauliflower, green beans, and squash and cook for 4 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Step2: Add the garlic to the skillet and cook and stir for 1 minute. Add Swanson® Chicken Broth and heat to a boil, stirring to scrape up the browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Reduce the heat to medium-high. Cook for 3 minutes or until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Season to taste.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 0.5 cup diced red bell pepper (1-inch), 1.5 cups thickly sliced cauliflower florets, 1 medium yellow squash, halved and sliced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup Swanson® Chicken Broth

title: Creamy Whiskey Mustard Sauce
description: An easy creamy mustard sauce with flavored with whiskey that goes perfectly well with salmon. Chopped pecans add crunch.
directions: Step1: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add chopped pecans and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and transfer buttered pecans to a small dish. Step2: Return saucepan to heat, pour in whiskey and allow the heat to burn off the alcohol. Add cream, Dijon mustard, and maple syrup; stir to combine. Bring to a gentle boil and cook until sauce thickens slightly, 1 to 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the chopped pecans back to the sauce, and serve immediately.
ingredients: 0.25 cup unsalted butter, 0.25 cup chopped pecans, 0.5 cup whiskey, 0.5 cup heavy cream, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon pure maple syrup, salt to taste, freshly ground white pepper to taste
